com.github.lucapino.confluence.helpers

Class ConfluenceClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.lucapino.confluence.helpers.ConfluenceClient

  • public class ConfluenceClient
extends Object
    A class that is capable of making requests to the confluence API. Example Usage: 
    
     String myURL = "http://confluence.organisation.org";
     String username = "...";
     String password = "...";
     ConfluenceClient client = ConfluenceClient.builder()
          .baseURL(myURL)
          .username(username)
          .password(password)
          .build();
     // search confluence instance by title and space key
     ContentResultList search =
     confluenceClient.getContentBySpaceKeyAndTitle("DEV", "A page or blog in DEV");
    Author:
    Jonathon Hope

      • convertContent

        public Storage convertContent(Storage storage,
                              Storage.Representation convertTo)
                       throws IOException
        Used for converting the storage format of a piece of content.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage instance to convert.
        convertTo - the representation to convert to.
        Returns:
        an instance of Storage that contains the result of the conversion request.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of error.
        See Also:
        Confluence Storage Format

      • postContentWithCallback

        public void postContentWithCallback(Content content,
                                    retrofit2.Callback<Content> callback)
        Performs a POST request with the body of the request containing the content, thus creating a new page or blog post on confluence.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to post to confluence.
        callback - this handle provides a means of inquiring about the success or failure of the invocation.

      • postContent

        public Content postContent(Content content)
                    throws IOException
        Performs a POST request with the body of the request containing the content, thus creating a new page or blog post on confluence.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to post to confluence.
        Returns:
        the result Content instance with the id field updated.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of error.

      • deleteContentById

        public void deleteContentById(String id)

        DELETE Content

        Trashes or purges a piece of Content, based on its ContentType and ContentStatus.

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the page of blog post to be deleted.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of error.

      • createSpace

                  throws IOException
        Creates a new Confluence Space using key and name of the given space.
        Parameters:
        space - the Space to create.
        Returns:
        the Space as a confirmation returned by Confluence REST API.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of error.

        Returns:

      • getChildren

        public List<Content> getChildren(String parentId,
                                 Type contentType)
                          throws IOException
        Fetch the children for a given Content identified by the parentId.
        Parameters:
        parentId - the id of the parent Content.
        contentType - the Type of Content.
        Returns:
        a list of all child content, matching the content with the given parentId.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of error.
